corporate protocol.`` Larry Page and Sergey Brin both hate being organized. They don't want to be locked into meetings,'' says Ken Auletta , who got to know both of them while writing his book, Googled: The End of the World as We Know It. While a freewheeling attitude typically works well at small companies, it could cause problems in a company as large as Google, says Steve Booth , a business professor at the University of Chicago.
